thread.title: UK to host European Commission’s aeronautics and air transport event
thread.title_full: UK to host European Commission’s aeronautics and air transport event

author: eTN Global Editor
title: UK to host European Commission’s aeronautics and air transport event
text:
UK to host European Commission’s aeronautics and air transport event Adv: 
Jul 20, 2015 Adv: 
LONDON, England - For the first time the UK is to host “Aerodays” the European Commission’s flagship event, the only gathering of its kind bringing together the very latest in research and innovation in aeronautics and air transport. 
The conference will showcase pioneering technological and industrial developments from across the aerospace sector providing a high-level, future-oriented perspective. It consists of technical workshops, plenary sessions, keynote speakers, networking events and technical visits. 
Speakers so far include: newly-appointed Warren East, Chief Executive of Rolls-Royce; Tom Enders, CEO, Airbus Group; Johan-Dietrich Wörner, Director General Elect for the European Space Agency; Carlos Moedas the European Commissioner for Research, Science and Innovation, and Tony Tyler the Director General and Chief Executive Officer of the International Air Transport Association (IATA). 
Central to the event will be Europe’s Vision for Aviation, ‘Flightpath 2050’. The European Commission’s initiative – which was launched during Aerodays 2011 – focuses on improving five key areas within the aviation sector: efficient and seamless mobility; competitiveness of industry; greening of aviation; safety and security; and skills for breakthroughs. 
ADS Group, the leading trade organisation for UK aerospace sector, hosting Aerodays on behalf of the European Commission, who through their framework programme for research and innovation, has co-funded much of the technology on show at the event. Central London 20-23 October 2015.
